meanings.definition: To produce more than (someone or something else)
meanings.sent1: The new factory was able to outproduce the old one.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's hard work allowed him to outproduce his neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The race between the two machines to outproduce each other was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The student's determination to outproduce all others was like a flame burning bright.
meanings.sent5: The sun seemed to outproduce all the stars in the night sky with its radiant light.

meanings.definition: To be more productive than (someone or something else)
meanings.sent1: With his efficient methods, he was able to outproduce his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The new software helped the team outproduce their previous sales records.
meanings.sent3: The competition to outproduce each other in the office was fierce but friendly.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity seemed to outproduce all others in the art class.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's determination to outproduce his own records was truly inspiring.
